Asselstine","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}.     * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators may not have allowance, and accounts with allowance may not be operators themselves."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}.     * Note that accounts cannot have allowance issued by their operators."},"authorizeOperator(address)":{"details":"See {IERC777-authorizeOperator}."},"balanceOf(address)":{"params":{"tokenHolder":"The user whose balance should be checked"},"return":"The users total balance of tokens."},"balanceOfUnderlying(address)":{"params":{"user":"The user whose balance should be checked"},"return":"The collateral value of the tokens held by the user."},"burn(uint256,bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC777-burn}.    * This contract does not support burning.  Redeem must be called."},"currentExchangeRateMantissa()":{"return":"The current exchange rate mantissa."},"decimals()":{"details":"See {ERC20Detailed-decimals}.     * Always returns 18, as per the [ERC777 EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-777#backward-compatibility)."},"defaultOperators()":{"details":"See {IERC777-defaultOperators}."},"deposit(uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of collateral to deposit","data":"Included user data"}},"granularity()":{"details":"See {IERC777-granularity}.     * This implementation always returns `1`."},"initialize(address)":{"params":{"_pool":"The Pool to bind this Pod to."}},"initialize(string,string,address[])":{"details":"`defaultOperators` may be an empty array."},"isOperatorFor(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC777-isOperatorFor}."},"name()":{"details":"See {IERC777-name}."},"operatorBurn(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC777-operatorBurn}.    * This contract does not support burning.  Redeem must be called."},"operatorDeposit(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of collateral to deposit","data":"Included user data","operatorData":"Included operator data","user":"The user on whose behalf to deposit"}},"operatorRedeem(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"params":{"account":"The user who is redeeming tokens","amount":"The amount of tokens to convert to collateral","data":"User data included with the tx","operatorData":"Operator data included with the tx"}},"operatorRedeemToPool(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"params":{"account":"The user who is redeeming tokens","amount":"The amount of tokens to convert to Pool tickets","data":"User data included with the tx","operatorData":"Operator data included with the tx"}},"operatorSend(address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient`. The caller must be an operator of `sender`.    * If send or receive hooks are registered for `sender` and `recipient`, the corresponding functions will be called with `data` and `operatorData`. See {IERC777Sender} and {IERC777Recipient}.    * Emits a {Sent} event.    * Requirements    * - `sender` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have at least `amount` tokens. - the caller must be an operator for `sender`. - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - if `recipient` is a contract, it must implement the {IERC777Recipient} interface."},"operatorWithdrawPendingDeposit(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount to withdraw","data":"Data included by the user","from":"The user on whose behalf to withdraw","operatorData":"Data included by the operator"}},"pendingDeposit(address)":{"params":{"user":"The user whose pending collateral balance should be returned."},"return":"The amount of collateral the user has deposited that has not converted to tokens."},"redeem(uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens to convert to collateral","data":"User data included with the tx"}},"redeemToPool(uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens to convert to Pool tickets","data":"User data included with the tx"}},"revokeOperator(address)":{"details":"See {IERC777-revokeOperator}."},"rewarded(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"PoolTogetherRewardListener callback that is triggered by the Pool when this Pod wins.","params":{"drawId":"The prize id that was won","winnings":"The amount of collateral won in the prize"}},"send(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`.    * If send or receive hooks are registered for the caller and `recipient`, the corresponding functions will be called with `data` and empty `operatorData`. See {IERC777Sender} and {IERC777Recipient}.    * Emits a {Sent} event.    * Requirements    * - the caller must have at least `amount` tokens. - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - if `recipient` is a contract, it must implement the {IERC777Recipient} interface."},"symbol()":{"details":"See {IERC777-symbol}."},"tokensReceived(address,address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"The number of tickets being transferred","from":"The user whose tickets are being transferred"}},"totalSupply()":{"return":"The total supply of tokens."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`.    * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.    * Emits a {Transfer} event."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance.    * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.    * Emits a {Transfer} event."},"withdrawPendingDeposit(uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount the user wishes to withdraw","data":"Data included by the user"}}},"title":"PoolTogether Pod"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"balanceOf(address)":{"notice":"Returns the number of tokens held by the given user.  Does not include pending deposits."},"balanceOfUnderlying(address)":{"notice":"Returns the collateral value of the given user's tokens. If the user does not have any tokens, this will be zero.  Pending deposits are not included."},"currentExchangeRateMantissa()":{"notice":"Returns the mantissa of the current exchange rate."},"deposit(uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Deposits into the Pod. The deposit will become Pod shares upon the next Pool reward."},"initialize(address)":{"notice":"Initializes the Pod."},"operatorDeposit(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Deposits on behalf of a user by an operator.  The deposit will become Pod shares upon the next Pool reward."},"operatorRedeem(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Allows an operator to redeem tokens for collateral on behalf of a user."},"operatorRedeemToPool(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Allows an operator to redeem tokens for Pool tickets on behalf of a user."},"operatorWithdrawPendingDeposit(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Allows an operator to withdraw a user's pending deposit on their behalf"},"pendingDeposit(address)":{"notice":"Returns the amount of collateral a user has deposited that is pending conversion to tokens."},"redeem(uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Allows a user to redeem tokens for collateral."},"redeemToPool(uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Allows a user to redeem tokens for Pool tickets"},"tokensReceived(address,address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"IERC777Recipient callback to handle direct Pool token transfers. When users transfer their Pool tickets to this contract they will be instantly converted into Pod shares."},"totalSupply()":{"notice":"Returns the total supply of tokens.  Does not included any pending deposits."},"withdrawPendingDeposit(uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Allows a user to withdraw their pending deposit"}},"notice":"Allows users to own shares in pooled tickets for a PoolTogether Pool * Designed to be bound to the PoolTogether Pool that support RewardListeners. * A RewardListener is a contract that is registered to be the reward listener for an address using the ERC 1820 registry. * When the Pool picks a winner, the Pool will look for a registered RewardListener.  If one exists, it calls `rewarded` on the listener with a stipend of 200000 gas. * In this way the Pod is able to track historic exchange rates."}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/chuckbergeron/Git/crypto/pool-together/pods/contracts/Pod.sol":"Pod"},"evmVersion":"petersburg","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/chuckbergeron/Git/crypto/pool-together/pods/contracts/ExchangeRateTracker.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8ed42fc5749741a351c0da23d91787618956e34c4912d23fd35662858b8ccf1e","urls":["bzz-raw://c2e0dfe102859efa8bf567230cc47012834deafda1aefa75c7a7f7f4841d07b8","dweb:/ipfs/QmV7QxX9SeZV6TSv8qefrFwm6tRuSrQVzciFgm2KRogRP5"]},"/Users/chuckbergeron/Git/crypto/pool-together/pods/contracts/FixedPoint.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1705dc68a77f6a23167bac3ff2d987d9a3194c0cb2db5a67dd1d083407d10a5c","urls":["bzz-raw://9f9bbbc0adebc3f83e1d3c66ecc4c17cf7560c8d8d86bbf114af2ae4c901347c","dweb:/ipfs/QmayBKpyW5ZuUrK6uig4rBanWktmeaAoWURDuaDxmMXaCk"]},"/Users/chuckbergeron/Git/crypto/pool-together/pods/contracts/Pod.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6ea3a4e314d8db680651f079ce101e7bab950a78516f7801dbeb2a31468785a4","urls":["bzz-raw://b481c9a6750698be95fcf3c65df17926cefba3589f787965d3461fab8da73f85","dweb:/ipfs/QmfYd7CmNWSMd4sMit6uYMNKiZYWQWQZNZmz4cgKGRdR3j"]},"/Users/chuckbergeron/Git/crypto/pool-together/pods/contracts/ScheduledBalance.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9a3d212338a68b4f0fe4f8d54f44436cd24b73e1ba4381beda32c87ae95b588d","urls":["bzz-raw://203a60f505340fc27f5b0d3f364a04c02f775247c5886532079f59c469dce3b9","dweb:/ipfs/QmZJ51sgKtDVx13aXZCEB77jqUpA2NGvp7NfRQaAo3aY87"]},"@kleros/kleros/contracts/data-structures/SortitionSumTreeFactory.sol":{"keccak256":"0x42614530f33b32e10cba4b1de0c3ecf6ff2e58599d8ff7ff1556052df02546d1","urls":["bzz-raw://505e577de7d8df1dc385e88109e64786c2224c5567896f4155b99534f9fc57b5","dweb:/ipfs/QmQLLX6ZNxsjDEMzsBxASw9j1WTRetDzmZDJVdDmDao81Y"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts-ethereum-package/contracts/GSN/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3491510fa4862af1a43f6c860d9cf7392240196540cd3c0eea79d374d419c5a1","urls":["bzz-raw://3e51386d74eb723d3acaaddafce1dd0b4082ad4c10ddba6b9fc154aad2930d02 nodes.documentation:
@dev Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`.
    * If send or receive hooks are registered for the caller and `recipient`,
the corresponding functions will be called with `data` and empty
`operatorData`. See {IERC777Sender} and {IERC777Recipient}.
    * Emits a {Sent} event.
    * Requirements
    * - the caller must have at least `amount` tokens.
- `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- if `recipient` is a contract, it must implement the {IERC777Recipient}
interface.
nodes.name: send

nodes.documentation:
@dev Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient`. The caller must
be an operator of `sender`.
    * If send or receive hooks are registered for `sender` and `recipient`,
the corresponding functions will be called with `data` and
`operatorData`. See {IERC777Sender} and {IERC777Recipient}.
    * Emits a {Sent} event.
    * Requirements
    * - `sender` cannot be the zero address.
- `sender` must have at least `amount` tokens.
- the caller must be an operator for `sender`.
- `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- if `recipient` is a contract, it must implement the {IERC777Recipient}
interface.

nodes.documentation:
@dev Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the
allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
allowance.
    * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
    * Emits a {Transfer} event.

_callTokensReceived

allowance(address,address).details: See {IERC20-allowance}.     * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators may not have allowance, and accounts with allowance may not be operators themselves.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Note that accounts cannot have allowance issued by their operators.

params.tokenHolder: The user whose balance should be checked

balanceOf(address).return: The users total balance of tokens.

params.user: The user whose balance should be checked

balanceOfUnderlying(address).return: The collateral value of the tokens held by the user.

burn(uint256,bytes).details: See {IERC777-burn}.    * This contract does not support burning.  Redeem must be called.

decimals().details: See {ERC20Detailed-decimals}.     * Always returns 18, as per the [ERC777 EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-777#backward-compatibility).

params.amount: The amount of collateral to deposit

params._pool: The Pool to bind this Pod to.

operatorBurn(address,uint256,bytes,bytes.details: See {IERC777-operatorBurn}.    * This contract does not support burning.  Redeem must be called.

params.amount: The amount of collateral to deposit
params.user: The user on whose behalf to deposit

params.account: The user who is redeeming tokens
params.amount: The amount of tokens to convert to collateral
params.data: User data included with the tx
params.operatorData: Operator data included with the tx

params.account: The user who is redeeming tokens
params.amount: The amount of tokens to convert to Pool tickets
params.data: User data included with the tx
params.operatorData: Operator data included with the tx

operatorSend(address,address,uint256,byt.details: Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient`. The caller must be an operator of `sender`.    * If send or receive hooks are registered for `sender` and `recipient`, the corresponding functions will be called with `data` and `operatorData`. See {IERC777Sender} and {IERC777Recipient}.    * Emits a {Sent} event.    * Requirements    * - `sender` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have at least `amount` tokens. - the caller must be an operator for `sender`. - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - if `recipient` is a contract, it must implement the {IERC777Recipient} interface.

params.from: The user on whose behalf to withdraw

params.user: The user whose pending collateral balance should be returned.

pendingDeposit(address).return: The amount of collateral the user has deposited that has not converted to tokens.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to convert to collateral
params.data: User data included with the tx

params.amount: The amount of tokens to convert to Pool tickets
params.data: User data included with the tx

rewarded(address,uint256,uint256).details: PoolTogetherRewardListener callback that is triggered by the Pool when this Pod wins.

params.drawId: The prize id that was won
params.winnings: The amount of collateral won in the prize

send(address,uint256,bytes).details: Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`.    * If send or receive hooks are registered for the caller and `recipient`, the corresponding functions will be called with `data` and empty `operatorData`. See {IERC777Sender} and {IERC777Recipient}.    * Emits a {Sent} event.    * Requirements    * - the caller must have at least `amount` tokens. - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - if `recipient` is a contract, it must implement the {IERC777Recipient} interface.

params.amount: The number of tickets being transferred
params.from: The user whose tickets are being transferred

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`.    * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.    * Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance.    * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.    * Emits a {Transfer} event.

params.amount: The amount the user wishes to withdraw

balanceOf(address).notice: Returns the number of tokens held by the given user.  Does not include pending deposits.

balanceOfUnderlying(address).notice: Returns the collateral value of the given user's tokens. If the user does not have any tokens, this will be zero.  Pending deposits are not included.

currentExchangeRateMantissa().notice: Returns the mantissa of the current exchange rate.

deposit(uint256,bytes).notice: Deposits into the Pod. The deposit will become Pod shares upon the next Pool reward.

operatorDeposit(address,uint256,bytes,by.notice: Deposits on behalf of a user by an operator.  The deposit will become Pod shares upon the next Pool reward.

operatorRedeem(address,uint256,bytes,byt.notice: Allows an operator to redeem tokens for collateral on behalf of a user.

operatorRedeemToPool(address,uint256,byt.notice: Allows an operator to redeem tokens for Pool tickets on behalf of a user.

operatorWithdrawPendingDeposit(address,u.notice: Allows an operator to withdraw a user's pending deposit on their behalf

pendingDeposit(address).notice: Returns the amount of collateral a user has deposited that is pending conversion to tokens.

redeem(uint256,bytes).notice: Allows a user to redeem tokens for collateral.

redeemToPool(uint256,bytes).notice: Allows a user to redeem tokens for Pool tickets

tokensReceived(address,address,address,u.notice: IERC777Recipient callback to handle direct Pool token transfers. When users transfer their Pool tickets to this contract they will be instantly converted into Pod shares.

totalSupply().notice: Returns the total supply of tokens.  Does not included any pending deposits.

withdrawPendingDeposit(uint256,bytes).notice: Allows a user to withdraw their pending deposit

userdoc.notice: Allows users to own shares in pooled tickets for a PoolTogether Pool * Designed to be bound to the PoolTogether Pool that support RewardListeners. * A RewardListener is a contract that is registered to be the reward listener for an address using the ERC 1820 registry. * When the Pool picks a winner, the Pool will look for a registered RewardListener.  If one exists, it calls `rewarded` on the listener with a stipend of 200000 gas. * In this way the Pod is able to track historic exchange rates.
